TopicTitle: I am scared(as in scar) for life.

Articles.Content:
My friend showed me a weird six hour song called "everywhere at the end of time" it is about dementia. I have not been able to sleep well since...

Edited October 3, 2022 by Ryaja
Don't stay with him for six hours.

18 hours ago, Cassy0110 said:

Is it worth to listen to? 

If you don't want to be scared, no. If you want to be scared then yes. the song slowly deteriorates to show what it is like to have dementia(not musical memory but like what happens to other memories) it has stages 1-6 which represent stages 2-7 of Alzheimer's disease.

Edited October 3, 2022 by Ryaja

there was that time i did the entire richard wagner ring cycle in one sitting.

17 hours.

Edited October 4, 2022 by Nuke

22 minutes ago, Nuke said:

there was that time i did the entire richard wagner ring cycle in one sitting.

17 hours.

Somebody was able to be playing it that long...

21 hours ago, kerbiloid said:

Somebody was able to be playing it that long...

"listened to" didnt seem appropriate. it was a recorded performance with subtitles. really makes opera watchable. 

i suppose i could try playing it on my guitar, downtuned of course with full crunch. of course i never developed callouses, so my fingers would be bleeding by the time brunhilda meets siegfried.

Edited October 5, 2022 by Nuke

i have this album where its just schizophrenics screaming whilst being stimulated by an anonymous black metal band. i wont link to it because it borderlines on exploitation, and so you probibly couldn't get it through anything but pirate channels anyway.
I sorta skipped through it. Not sure what the big deal is. To the extent they think it maps to anything real it's interesting I guess.
Let's rename this into the "Coming Heat Death of the Universe", and the depressive screaming will turn into gorgeous symphony.

My friend showed me a weird six hour song called "everywhere at the end of time" it is about dementia. I have not been able to sleep well since...

Oh yeah, I've heard a bit of it. Pretty darn spooky stuff, but you usually forget (pun intended) about this kind of thing eventually.

*Tense laughter* I get jumpy when I here 1920's style music now.

I skipped through too, but I get scared of Minecraft caves on peaceful so I guess I probably have it amplified on me

16 hours ago, Ryaja said:

*Tense laughter* I get jumpy when I here 1920's style music now.

I skipped through too, but I get scared of Minecraft caves on peaceful so I guess I probably have it amplified on me

i always thought the little freakout sounds in mincraft were a clever bit of sound design. a lot of games skimp on the atmospherics. quake had a good ambiance soundtrack that complemented the game, but it was just pre-recorded music and not event driven. freespace had event driven music but was not really ambiance, the tempo just picked up when you commenced a fightin'. after that sound design became somewhat of an afterthought, a solved problem that was best left to sound artists. minecraft is a programmers game, so its nice to see that they can use sound creatively despite being code monkies.
